Package itemManagement

Class Inventory

  • java.lang.Object
    • itemManagement.Inventory
  • public class Inventory
extends java.lang.Object
    The Inventory class of the game which holds the data for all available items for the player
    Author:
    Jason Smit, Ariel Evangelista

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static Inventory _session
      The one and only one instance of the Inventory class

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addCoins​(int cost)
      Add coins to the player's wallet
      void addItem​(Item item)
      Adds a given item to the players inventory, if the item is not in the list then the item will be added.
      boolean canAfford​(int cost)
      Check if the player can afford some item
      void deductItem​(Item item)
      Deducts a given item to the players inventory then it's count will be incremented.
      int getCoins()
      Returns the player's wallet value as an integer
      java.util.List<Item> getFoods()
      Gets the list of all items in the players inventory that are of type food and returns it.
      static Inventory getInstance()
      Checks if there is already an instance of the Inventory, if not then one will be created.
      java.util.List<Item> getMisc()
      Gets the list of all items in the players inventory that are of type misc and returns it.
      java.util.List<Item> getPotions()
      Gets the list of all items in the players inventory that are of type potion and returns it.
      java.lang.String getWallet()
      Returns the players wallet value as a string to be displayed in the inventory window.
      void payItem​(int cost)
      Pays for an item bought by the player
      void resetInv()
      Resets the inventory fresh for a new game

    • Field Detail

      • _session

        public static Inventory _session
        The one and only one instance of the Inventory class

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Inventory getInstance()
        Checks if there is already an instance of the Inventory, if not then one will be created.
        Returns:
        The instance of the Inventory (can only ever have one.)

      • getPotions

        public java.util.List<Item> getPotions()
        Gets the list of all items in the players inventory that are of type potion and returns it.
        Returns:
        A List holding all the potions currently in the players inventory.

      • getFoods

        public java.util.List<Item> getFoods()
        Gets the list of all items in the players inventory that are of type food and returns it.
        Returns:
        A List holding all the foods currently in the players inventory.

      • getMisc

        public java.util.List<Item> getMisc()
        Gets the list of all items in the players inventory that are of type misc and returns it.
        Returns:
        A List holding all the miscs currently in the players inventory.

      • getWallet

        public java.lang.String getWallet()
        Returns the players wallet value as a string to be displayed in the inventory window.
        Returns:
        A String describing the players wallet value.

      • getCoins

        public int getCoins()
        Returns the player's wallet value as an integer
        Returns:
        An Integer representing the players wallet value

      • canAfford

        public boolean canAfford​(int cost)
        Check if the player can afford some item
        Parameters:
        cost - The cost of the item a player tries to buy
        Returns:
        Returns true if the player can afford the item

      • payItem

        public void payItem​(int cost)
        Pays for an item bought by the player
        Parameters:
        cost - The cost of the item a player bought

      • addCoins

        public void addCoins​(int cost)
        Add coins to the player's wallet
        Parameters:
        cost - The number of coins to be added to the wallet

      • addItem

        public void addItem​(Item item)
        Adds a given item to the players inventory, if the item is not in the list then the item will be added. If the item is already in the list then it's count will be incremented.
        Parameters:
        item - A Item object representing the item to be added to the inventory.

      • deductItem

        public void deductItem​(Item item)
        Deducts a given item to the players inventory then it's count will be incremented.
        Parameters:
        item - A Item object representing the item to be deducted to the inventory.

      • resetInv

        public void resetInv()
        Resets the inventory fresh for a new game
